image.altText: Anthony Albanese shakes hands with albo in the studio

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton and Prime Minister Anthony Albanese traded blows on cost of living, housing, climate and dealing with US President Donald Trump.

title.children: Dutton admits second mistake, and other takeaways from ABC Leaders Debate

image.altText: Albanese and Dutton stand at separate podiums on a tv set.

props.synopsis: The second debate revealed an opposition leader still trying to trade off voters not feeling better off than they did three years ago and a prime minister not able to answer all the questions about how he would improve underlying problems in the economy.

title.children: When the debate turned to Trump, a gap emerged between Dutton and Albanese

image.altText: A man wearing a grey t-shirt holds a phone.

props.synopsis: When voter Peter Magor received an unsolicited campaign email from the Liberal Party, he assumed he could unsubscribe. But the link to do so directed him to a Liberal Party website with no option to do so.

title.children: Liberal Party data collection site hidden beneath unsubscribe link

image.altText: A red chart tracking stocks falling

props.synopsis: While the past few days has seen calmness return to markets, many of the financial world's best minds fear further falls — and warn we're nowhere near the end, unless America backs away from its current policy. One analyst warns we're witnessing something not seen since the Great Depression.

title.children: Why the market meltdowns may have been a trial run

image.altText: Two men in prison suits are knelt on the floor as guards shave their heads.

props.synopsis: Officials in Donald Trump's administration could face criminal prosecution, a US judge says, because they have shown "wilful disregard" for a bar on deporting alleged gang members to El Salvador.

title.children: Trump administration wilfully defied court order on deportations, judge finds

props.synopsis: The prime minister has appeared on many podcasts this year to make his case for re-election. It turns out the firm quietly facilitating these appearances was a left-field choice.

title.children: Company linked to Betoota Advocate to run PM's re-election podcast strategy

image.altText: Peter Dutton press conference

props.synopsis: Today on the campaign trail the opposition leader doubles down on his response to a report about Russia seeking access to a military base in Papua, the Speaker of the House might soon be out of a job and an MP campaigns on OnlyFans.

title.children: Dutton takes Churchill's advice to heart and keeps doubling down

image.altText: A man stood on rocks on the edge of the ocean

props.synopsis: Australia's weather will be firing on all cylinders this Easter long weekend, with a cyclone in the north, powerful swell in the east and a swing from hot to cool in the south.

title.children: A cyclone, swell, and cool change: What's in store for Easter weather?

image.altText: A large pile of rubbish on a street.

props.synopsis: Birmingham residents haven't had their rubbish collected in six weeks, as a pay dispute between bin workers and the council leads to trash piling up in public spaces and rodents running rampant.

title.children: No end in sight for UK city's 'disgusting' rat and rubbish nightmare

image.altText: Two men sit in different yellow-coloured armchairs looking at each other smirking in an ornate room

props.synopsis: Analysts say countries around the world will be watching the outcome of the meeting closely to determine how best to negotiate on the issue of US tariffs.

title.children: US and Japan aim for deal on tariffs as Donald Trump joins talks

image.altText: A 17-year-old with large headphones resting on his shoulders poses for a portrait in front of his gaming PC.

props.synopsis: Popular video games are utilising harmful tactics to trap kids into spending more cash and more time gaming, a new consumer report finds.

title.children: Kids trapped for hours by deceptive video game features, report finds

image.altText: A foreign airline passenger is greeted by a Customs and Border Protection Officer at an immigration desk.

props.synopsis: Immigration lawyers provide advice on US travel, as border security officials conduct 'enhanced vetting' of travellers with broad powers to refuse any visa holder entry.

title.children: Travelling to the US? Immigration lawyers suggest using a burner phone

image.altText: 2025-04-11T132657Z_952076589_RC2PVDAU6Q9K_RTRMADP_3_RUSSIA-PUTIN

props.synopsis: Russia defends its military cooperation with Jakarta in its first direct response to claims that it sought access to an Indonesian air base.

title.children: Russia responds to claims it sought access to Indonesian air base

image.altText: Donald Trump with his hand in the air as he disembarks a plane

props.synopsis: A Lowy Institute poll has found voters are almost evenly split on whether Peter Dutton or Anthony Albanese would be better placed to manage Australia's relationship with Donald Trump, but back the Labor leader when it comes to Xi Jinping.

title.children: Australians' trust in the US falls to two-decade low since Trump re-election

image.altText: blue and white police tape

props.synopsis: Police charged the 15-year-old boy with "allegedly using an encrypted application to facilitate plans for overseas contract killings."

title.children: Boy, 15, charged in Sydney with organising contract killings online

image.altText: A group of women wearing blue suits

props.synopsis: I've often wished we could all have a brief moment of hurtling around the Earth, not to posture or preen, but to show the opposite — we are small, we are humble, and we need to fiercely care for the Earth.

title.children: A billionaire-funded space flight has nothing to do with women’s empowerment

image.altText: A young white man with short brown hair and glasses sitting with a middle aged white woman with long blonde hair

props.synopsis: New research shows a sharp rise in HECS debts, despite graduate earning power declining, as student loans become a potent election issue for the first time.

title.children: Coalition slams Labor's 'elitist' HECS relief proposal, setting up election showdown

image.altText: A man in a black shirt sits on a couch with his right arm around a woman in a white shirt.

props.synopsis: Leah Pitman and Dustin Atkinson say failings at Northern Beaches Hospital caused the death of their newborn baby Harper. This is their harrowing and heartbreaking story.

title.children: Leah was 'heartbroken' by a toddler's death. A day later she suffered a similar tragedy

image.altText: A man is giving a speech, pointing up with one finger

props.synopsis: Former US President Joe Biden has criticised  President Donald Trump for taking "a hatchet" to the popular social security government agency that provides benefits to more than 70 million Americans.

title.children: Biden slams Trump in first speech since leaving White House

image.altText: Women's rights activists hold placards that say women are born

props.synopsis: The court upheld an appeal by a campaign group on whether transgender women are legally women under equality legislation.

title.children: UK court rules a woman is defined by the gender at birth

image.altText: Four men stand behind a table as three men cut a large brown chocolate cake standing in front of an ATM

props.synopsis: Residents on the Pacific island of Tuvalu have previously withdrawn cash from banks on payday, with long queues ensuing at bank branches.

title.children: This country has electronic banking for the first time ever

image.altText: A slim young woman sits crossed legged in a van while a young man in a baseball hat smiles broadly

props.synopsis: Dozens of young Australians reached out to Gabby Petito's family after a documentary series on her death launched in Australia

title.children: Young Aussies are identifying with Gabby Petito's story

image.altText: Tradies work on the roof frame of a new home under construction.

props.synopsis: The Coalition says it wants to "rebalance" the school system to better promote trades and apprenticeships.

title.children: Dutton pledges to bring back Howard-era technical schools

image.altText: An IV drip is seen hanging from a medical hook.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors are accusing the unnamed doctor of acting out of a "lust" for killing.

title.children: German doctor charged with murdering 15 patients

image.altText: A Qantas plane on the tarmac.

props.synopsis: Federal police are ramping up their presence at Darwin Airport after a rise in "obnoxious" and "abusive" drunken passengers in the past 12 months.

title.children: Darwin Airport records rise in passengers too drunk to fly

image.altText: A smiling man in high-vis leans against a large piece of equipment in front of a tunnel at a mine site.

props.synopsis: Australia's biggest gold miner Northern Star Resources has added a rich new discovery in WA's Pilbara to its portfolio after shareholders in De Grey Mining overwhelmingly voted in favour of a takeover.

title.children: Owner of Kalgoorlie's Super Pit completes $5bn gold takeover

image.altText: A man wearing a aussie yellow and gold shirt kissing a jar of vegemite

props.synopsis: Australian PM and cafe owner Leighton Walters say the dispute over the added vitamins in Vegemite is "rather odd" given Canada accepts shipments of UK's Marmite.

title.children: Australian PM backs cafe owner in Canada over Vegemite dispute with regulators

image.altText: WA's Legislative Council, a red room with lots of seats and people sitting in them.

props.synopsis: The make-up of WA's new look upper house is confirmed by the WA Electoral Commission, with a bigger crossbench including two One Nation members.

title.children: One Nation wins two upper house seats in WA as final make-up revealed

image.altText: A cardboard box with survival products in it. A person's hand is reaching into the box.

props.synopsis: With war on their doorstep, Europeans have been warned to prepare survival kits with enough essentials to last them 72 hours, and Britain's leading disaster expert says the idea has been borrowed from Australia.

title.children: Europeans told to gather supplies for 72 hours amid 'direct' war threat

image.altText: A saltwater crocodile poking its head out of a body of water.

props.synopsis: An illegal foreign fisher was taken to hospital after a suspected crocodile attack in NT waters, which authorities believe occurred days before they intercepted the vessel.

title.children: Foreign fisher taken to hospital after suspected crocodile attack

image.altText: A woman and a man standing outside of a home near a fence.

props.synopsis: Home ownership rates in Australia have been falling for decades, and with rental vacancies at record lows and prices at historic highs, many fear their dream of owning a home may be out of reach. Some experts say rental caps could help.

title.children: Australia's growing renter population say homeownership is out of reach

image.altText: Kilmar Abrego Garcia wears a black t-shirt and Chicago Bulls cap.

props.synopsis: A judge who ruled that Kilmar Abrego Garcia was wrongfully deported to El Salvador last month has slammed the Trump administration for doing "nothing" to facilitate his return.

title.children: Judge says Trump officials did 'nothing' to return wrongly deported man

image.altText: Xavier Willison is put through a warm-up by a teammate

props.synopsis: The Broncos turn to wrestling in a bid to be a more physical side after being shown up by the Roosters at the weekend.

title.children: Broncos players put through full-squad wrestling session in bid to 'man up'

image.altText: Sarah Cunningham with partner and baby

props.synopsis: Census data shows the number of one-child families in Australia has more than doubled in the past 40 years. We spoke to mums who are happily "one and done" to learn more.

title.children: Parents on why they're happily 'one and done'
